page.title: 15BURGHFIELD COM'N-LEISURE 2
page.content: The Willink School is the local centre for evening classes and the village library,whilst the new village hall, although too small for sports activ- ities,is used by many groups for meet- ings,receptions and fund-raising events.Regular clubs include a camera society,a drama society and the well- established Horticultural Society.For the zealous gardeners,there is a much- used allotment site. However,despite the many activities available,many teenagers in the area feel left out,and vandalism is becom- ing an increasing problem.Many people feel that the extensive residential development should be accompanied by suitable leisure development,and a local sports centre for family-use has been called for. The many public houses in the area are also a major leisure resource.
